name: Congenital Erythropoietic Porphyria with Secondary Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis
chief_complaint: My child has been very pale, tired, and their urine is dark red.
prognosis: Guarded without HSCT; potential for progressive liver damage and life-threatening HLH complications
description: An extremely rare autosomal recessive disorder of heme biosynthesis characterized by uroporphyrinogen III synthase deficiency, leading to accumulation of nonphysiologic porphyrin isomers. The secondary HLH represents a potentially fatal hyperinflammatory complication triggered by the underlying metabolic disease.
multiple_choice: Congenital Erythropoietic Porphyria with Secondary Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis
